intro: Rytigynia decussata, commonly known as the Brazilian pepper tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves with opposite leaflets. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed. Rytigynia decussata is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some medicinal uses in traditional medicine.
